# Siege of Charleston

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

This article is about the siege during the [American Revolutionary
War](/wiki/American_Revolutionary_War "American Revolutionary War"). For the
1776 British attempt to capture Charleston, see [Battle of Sullivan's
Island](/wiki/Battle_of_Sullivan%27s_Island "Battle of Sullivan's Island").
For the [American Civil War](/wiki/American_Civil_War "American Civil War")
sieges, see [Battle of Charleston
(disambiguation)](/wiki/Battle_of_Charleston_\(disambiguation\) "Battle of
Charleston \(disambiguation\)").

The **Siege of Charleston** was a major engagement fought between March 29 to
May 12, 1780 during the [American Revolutionary
War](/wiki/American_Revolutionary_War "American Revolutionary War"). The
[British](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Great_Britain "Kingdom of Great Britain"),
following the [collapse of their northern strategy](/wiki/Battles_of_Saratoga
"Battles of Saratoga") and their [withdrawal from
Philadelphia](/wiki/Philadelphia_campaign "Philadelphia campaign"), shifted
their focus to the [American](/wiki/United_States "United States") [Southern
Colonies](/wiki/Southern_Colonies "Southern Colonies").

After approximately six weeks of siege, Major General [Benjamin
Lincoln](/wiki/Benjamin_Lincoln "Benjamin Lincoln"), commanding the Charleston
garrison, surrendered his forces to the British, resulting in one of the worst
[American](/wiki/United_States "United States") defeats of the war.

##
Background[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_Charleston&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Background")]

See also: [Southern theater of the American Revolutionary
War](/wiki/Southern_theater_of_the_American_Revolutionary_War "Southern
theater of the American Revolutionary War")

By late 1779, two major British strategic efforts had failed. An army invading
from [Quebec](/wiki/Quebec "Quebec") under [John Burgoyne](/wiki/John_Burgoyne
"John Burgoyne") had surrendered to the Americans under [Horatio
Gates](/wiki/Horatio_Gates "Horatio Gates") at the [Battles of
Saratoga](/wiki/Battles_of_Saratoga "Battles of Saratoga"), compelling the
[Kingdom of France](/wiki/Kingdom_of_France "Kingdom of France") and
[Spain](/wiki/Spain "Spain") to declare war on [Great
Britain](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Great_Britain "Kingdom of Great Britain") in support
of the Americans. Meanwhile, a strategic effort led by [Sir William
Howe](/wiki/William_Howe,_5th_Viscount_Howe "William Howe, 5th Viscount Howe")
to capture the Revolutionary capital of [Philadelphia](/wiki/Philadelphia
"Philadelphia") had met with limited success. Having replaced his superior as
Commander-in-Chief of the American Station, [Sir Henry
Clinton](/wiki/Henry_Clinton_\(American_War_of_Independence\) "Henry Clinton
\(American War of Independence\)") withdrew all his forces back to [New York
City](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City") to reinforce the city against a
possible Franco-American attack.[3]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/CharlestownSC1780.jpg/300px-
CharlestownSC1780.jpg)](/wiki/File:CharlestownSC1780.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:CharlestownSC1780.jpg "Enlarge")

Detail of a 1780 map drawn by a British engineer showing the Charleston
defenses

Stymied by the [Fabian strategy](/wiki/Fabian_strategy "Fabian strategy")
adopted by [George Washington](/wiki/George_Washington "George Washington"),
and, under increasing political pressure to deliver victory, the British
turned to launching their ["Southern
Strategy"](/wiki/Southern_theatre_of_the_American_Revolutionary_War "Southern
theatre of the American Revolutionary War") for forcing a capitulation of the
Americans. The British were persuaded that there was a strong
[Loyalist](/wiki/Loyalist_\(American_Revolution\) "Loyalist \(American
Revolution\)") sentiment in the south. It was expected that these Loyalists
would rise against the American
[Patriots](/wiki/Patriot_\(American_Revolution\) "Patriot \(American
Revolution\)") in large numbers. The opening British move was the [Capture of
Savannah](/wiki/Capture_of_Savannah "Capture of Savannah"),
[Georgia](/wiki/Georgia_\(U.S._state\) "Georgia \(U.S. state\)") in December
1778. After repulsing an [assault on Savannah](/wiki/Siege_of_Savannah "Siege
of Savannah") by a combined Franco-American force in October 1779, the British
planned to capture [Charleston, South
Carolina](/wiki/Charleston,_South_Carolina "Charleston, South Carolina"),
intending to use the city as a base for further operations in the southern
colonies.[3]

[Sir Henry Clinton](/wiki/Henry_Clinton_\(American_War_of_Independence\)
"Henry Clinton \(American War of Independence\)") evacuated [Newport, Rhode
Island](/wiki/Newport,_Rhode_Island "Newport, Rhode Island") in Oct. 1779, and
left the substantial garrison of [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City "New York
City") under the command of [Wilhelm von
Knyphausen](/wiki/Wilhelm_von_Knyphausen "Wilhelm von Knyphausen"). In
December, the day after Christmas 1779, Clinton and his second in command
[Charles Cornwallis](/wiki/Charles_Cornwallis,_1st_Marquess_Cornwallis
"Charles Cornwallis, 1st Marquess Cornwallis"), sailed southward with 8,500
troops and 5,000 sailors on 90 troopships and 14 warships. After a very stormy
voyage, the fleet anchored in Savannah River on 1 Feb. 1780. By 12 Feb.,
Clinton had landed his army 30 miles south of Charleston on [Simmons
Island](/wiki/Seabrook_Island,_South_Carolina "Seabrook Island, South
Carolina"). By 24 Feb., the British had crossed the [Stono
River](/wiki/Stono_River "Stono River") onto [James
Island](/wiki/James_Island,_South_Carolina "James Island, South Carolina"),
and by 10 March, Lord Cornwallis had made it to the mainland. By 22 March,
they had advanced to [Middleton Place](/wiki/Middleton_Place "Middleton
Place") and [Drayton Hall](/wiki/Drayton_Hall "Drayton Hall"), and on 29 March
1780, crossed the [Ashley River](/wiki/Ashley_River_\(South_Carolina\) "Ashley
River \(South Carolina\)").[3]:39–40,42,44

## Siege[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_Charleston&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Siege")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Charlestownmap.jpeg/300px-
Charlestownmap.jpeg)](/wiki/File:Charlestownmap.jpeg)

[](/wiki/File:Charlestownmap.jpeg "Enlarge")

Charleston map showing the distribution of British forces during the siege

Cutting the city off from relief, Clinton began a siege of the city on April
1, 800 yards from the American fortifications located at today's [Marion
Square](/wiki/Marion_Square "Marion Square"). Whipple, deciding the
[bar](/wiki/Mouth_bar "Mouth bar") was undefendable, ended up
[scuttling](/wiki/Scuttling "Scuttling") his fleet at the mouth of the [Cooper
River](/wiki/Cooper_River_\(South_Carolina\) "Cooper River \(South
Carolina\)"). Then Arbuthnot, on 8 April, brought his 14 vessels safely into
the harbor, past the roaring guns of [Fort Moultrie](/wiki/Fort_Moultrie "Fort
Moultrie"), the same day Woodford arrived with 750 [Virginia
Continentals](/wiki/Virginia_Line "Virginia Line").[3]:46,52–53,55–57

In order to consolidate British control of the immediate area, Clinton
dispatched [Banastre Tarleton](/wiki/Banastre_Tarleton "Banastre Tarleton")
and [Patrick Ferguson](/wiki/Patrick_Ferguson "Patrick Ferguson") to capture
[Monck's Corner](/wiki/Battle_of_Monck%27s_Corner "Battle of Monck's Corner")
on 14 April. On 18 April, [Lt. Col. Lord Rawdon](/wiki/Francis_Rawdon-
Hastings,_1st_Marquess_of_Hastings "Francis Rawdon-Hastings, 1st Marquess of
Hastings") arrived with 2,500 men, including the 42nd Highlanders, the Hessian
von Ditfurth Regiment, the Queen's Rangers, Prince of Wales American
Volunteers, and the Volunteers of Ireland. Charleston was then completely
surrounded.[3]:60–64

Governor [John Rutledge](/wiki/John_Rutledge "John Rutledge") escaped on 13
April, before Cornwallis crossed the Cooper River, and joined Webster in
blocking escape from the left bank. On 21 April, Lincoln requested a surrender
with "[Honours of war](/wiki/Honours_of_war "Honours of war")", which was
rejected by Clinton. On 25 April, civilians led by [Christopher
Gadsden](/wiki/Christopher_Gadsden "Christopher Gadsden") prevented any action
on Lincoln's part in withdrawing the Continental regiments. On 6 May, Tarleton
won another engagement in the [Battle of Lenud's
Ferry](/wiki/Battle_of_Lenud%27s_Ferry "Battle of Lenud's Ferry"), while the
British siege works had advanced far enough towards the Charleston
fortifications to drain the canal in front.[3]:66–67[4][5][6][7]

On 7 May, Fort Moultrie surrendered without a fight. On May 8, Clinton called
for Lincoln's unconditional surrender, but Lincoln again attempted to
negotiate for the honours of war. On May 11, Gadsden and other citizens asked
Lincoln to surrender. While on the same day, the British fired [heated
shot](/wiki/Heated_shot "Heated shot") into the city, burning several homes,
compelling Lincoln to call for a parlay to negotiate terms for surrender. On
May 12, Lincoln formally surrendered 3,371 men to the British.[3][3]:69–70

When word reached the back-country, the American troops holding Ninety-Six and
Camden also surrendered to the British.[2]

##
Aftermath[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_Charleston&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Aftermath")]

[Prison hulks](/wiki/Prison_hulks "Prison hulks") awaited the majority of the
2,571 Continental prisoners, while [parole](/wiki/Parole "Parole") was granted
to the militia and civilians who promised not to take up arms. However, this
also meant there no longer existed an American army in the South.[3]:70

The British captured some 5,266 prisoners, 311 artillery pieces, 9,178
artillery rounds, 5,916 muskets, 33,000 rounds of ammunition, 15 Regimental
colours, 49 ships and 120 boats, plus 376 barrels of flour, and large
magazines of rum, rice and indigo.[2] Following the surrender, the captured
ordnance was brought to a powder magazine. A Hessian officer warned that some
of the guns might still be loaded, but he was ignored. One prematurely fired,
detonating 180 barrels of powder, further discharging 5,000 muskets in the
magazine. The accident killed approximately 200 people and destroyed six
houses.[2] The prisoners of the siege were diverted to multiple locations,
including prison shops, the old barracks where the [College of
Charleston](/wiki/College_of_Charleston "College of Charleston") is today, and
the [Old Exchange and Provost](/wiki/Exchange_and_Provost "Exchange and
Provost") "Dungeon".

The defeat was a serious blow to the American cause. It was the largest
surrender of an American force under arms, until the 1862 surrender of
[Union](/wiki/Union_\(American_Civil_War\) "Union \(American Civil War\)")
troops at [Harper's Ferry](/wiki/Battle_of_Harper%27s_Ferry "Battle of
Harper's Ferry") during the [Antietam Campaign](/wiki/Antietam_Campaign
"Antietam Campaign"). The surrender left no substantial army in the South, and
the colonies were wide open for a British advance. The British troops
consolidated their hold, and had driven the remaining Continental Army troops
from South Carolina consequent to the May 29 [Battle of
Waxhaws](/wiki/Battle_of_Waxhaws "Battle of Waxhaws").

During their surrender the American forces were denied [honours of
war](/wiki/Honours_of_war "Honours of war"), leading General [George
Washington](/wiki/George_Washington "George Washington") to deny the same to
the British during their surrender at the [Siege of
Yorktown](/wiki/Siege_of_Yorktown "Siege of Yorktown"), with Washington saying
"The same Honors will be granted to the Surrendering Army as were granted to
the Garrison of Charles Town."[7]

On June 5, Clinton sailed back to New York City, believing his presence
necessary to defend against a potential Franco-American attack, leaving
command of the southern theatre to [Lord
Cornwallis](/wiki/Charles_Cornwallis,_1st_Marquess_Cornwallis "Charles
Cornwallis, 1st Marquess Cornwallis"), with orders to reduce opposition in
[North Carolina](/wiki/North_Carolina "North Carolina"). Though the effects of
the surrender at Charleston was substantial, the British err in strategy soon
became apparent. There was no popular uprising of Loyalists that the British
command had been assured would happen, making control of the countryside
difficult. Instead, resistance in South Carolina degenerated into a period of
chaotic guerrilla warfare in the outlying areas.

## Order of
Battle[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_Charleston&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Order of Battle")]

### British
forces[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_Charleston&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: British forces")]

The joint British naval-army forces were led overall by [Sir Henry
Clinton](/wiki/Henry_Clinton_\(American_War_of_Independence\) "Henry Clinton
\(American War of Independence\)"), with his subordinate, [Lord
Cornwallis](/wiki/Charles_Cornwallis,_1st_Marquess_Cornwallis "Charles
Cornwallis, 1st Marquess Cornwallis") as his second-in-command. The British
regular troops were led by Brigadier General [Alexander
Leslie](/wiki/Alexander_Leslie_\(British_Army_officer\) "Alexander Leslie
\(British Army officer\)").

The ground and naval forces were composed thus:

[hide]British Order of Battle[2][8]  
---  
  
  * 1st Battalion of [Light Infantry](/wiki/History_of_British_light_infantry "History of British light infantry"), composed of the Light Companies of the [7th](/wiki/Royal_Fusiliers "Royal Fusiliers"), [22nd](/wiki/Cheshire_Regiment "Cheshire Regiment"), [33rd](/wiki/Duke_of_Wellington%27s_Regiment "Duke of Wellington's Regiment"), [37th](/wiki/37th_\(North_Hampshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "37th \(North Hampshire\) Regiment of Foot"), [42nd](/wiki/42nd_Regiment_of_Foot "42nd Regiment of Foot"), [54th](/wiki/54th_\(West_Norfolk\)_Regiment_of_Foot "54th \(West Norfolk\) Regiment of Foot"), [63rd](/wiki/63rd_\(West_Suffolk\)_Regiment_of_Foot "63rd \(West Suffolk\) Regiment of Foot"), [70th](/wiki/70th_\(Surrey\)_Regiment_of_Foot "70th \(Surrey\) Regiment of Foot") and the [74th](/wiki/74th_Regiment_of_\(Highland\)_Foot "74th Regiment of \(Highland\) Foot") Regiments of Foot (640).
  * 2nd Battalion of [Light Infantry](/wiki/History_of_British_light_infantry "History of British light infantry"), composed of the Light Companies of the [23rd](/wiki/Royal_Welch_Fusiliers "Royal Welch Fusiliers"), [38th](/wiki/38th_\(1st_Staffordshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "38th \(1st Staffordshire\) Regiment of Foot"), [43rd](/wiki/43rd_\(Monmouthshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "43rd \(Monmouthshire\) Regiment of Foot"), [57th](/wiki/57th_\(West_Middlesex\)_Regiment_of_Foot "57th \(West Middlesex\) Regiment of Foot"), [64th](/wiki/64th_\(2nd_Staffordshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "64th \(2nd Staffordshire\) Regiment of Foot"), [76th](/wiki/76th_Regiment_of_Foot "76th Regiment of Foot"), 80th, and the [84th](/wiki/84th_Regiment_of_Foot_\(Royal_Highland_Emigrants\) "84th Regiment of Foot \(Royal Highland Emigrants\)") Regiments of Foot (637).
  * 1st Battalion of [Grenadiers](/wiki/Grenadier "Grenadier"), composed of the Grenadier Companies of the [7th](/wiki/Royal_Fusiliers "Royal Fusiliers"), [17th](/wiki/Royal_Leicestershire_Regiment "Royal Leicestershire Regiment"), [23rd](/wiki/Royal_Welch_Fusiliers "Royal Welch Fusiliers"), [33rd](/wiki/Duke_of_Wellington%27s_Regiment "Duke of Wellington's Regiment"), [37th](/wiki/37th_\(North_Hampshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "37th \(North Hampshire\) Regiment of Foot"), [38th](/wiki/38th_\(1st_Staffordshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "38th \(1st Staffordshire\) Regiment of Foot"), [42nd](/wiki/42nd_Regiment_of_Foot "42nd Regiment of Foot"), and the [43rd](/wiki/43rd_\(Monmouthshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "43rd \(Monmouthshire\) Regiment of Foot") Regiments of Foot (611).
  * 2nd Battalion of [Grenadiers](/wiki/Grenadier "Grenadier"), composed of the Grenadier Companies of the [22nd](/wiki/Cheshire_Regiment "Cheshire Regiment"), [54th](/wiki/54th_\(West_Norfolk\)_Regiment_of_Foot "54th \(West Norfolk\) Regiment of Foot"), [57th](/wiki/57th_\(West_Middlesex\)_Regiment_of_Foot "57th \(West Middlesex\) Regiment of Foot"), [63rd](/wiki/63rd_\(West_Suffolk\)_Regiment_of_Foot "63rd \(West Suffolk\) Regiment of Foot"), [64th](/wiki/64th_\(2nd_Staffordshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "64th \(2nd Staffordshire\) Regiment of Foot"), [70th](/wiki/70th_\(Surrey\)_Regiment_of_Foot "70th \(Surrey\) Regiment of Foot"), and the [74th](/wiki/74th_Regiment_of_\(Highland\)_Foot "74th Regiment of \(Highland\) Foot") Regiments of Foot (526).
  * [7th Regiment of Foot](/wiki/Royal_Fusiliers "Royal Fusiliers") (463).
  * [23rd Regiment of Foot](/wiki/Royal_Welch_Fusiliers "Royal Welch Fusiliers") (400).
  * [33rd Regiment of Foot](/wiki/Duke_of_Wellington%27s_Regiment "Duke of Wellington's Regiment") (450).
  * [63rd Regiment of Foot](/wiki/63rd_\(West_Suffolk\)_Regiment_of_Foot "63rd \(West Suffolk\) Regiment of Foot") (400).
  * [64th Regiment of Foot](/wiki/64th_\(2nd_Staffordshire\)_Regiment_of_Foot "64th \(2nd Staffordshire\) Regiment of Foot") (350).
  * 2nd Battalion of the [60th Regiment of Foot](/wiki/King%27s_Royal_Rifle_Corps "King's Royal Rifle Corps") (45).
  * A Brigade of four battalions of Hessian [Grenadiers](/wiki/Grenadier "Grenadier") (1,525).
  * [King's American Regiment](/wiki/King%27s_American_Regiment "King's American Regiment") of [Loyalists](/wiki/Loyalist_\(American_Revolution\) "Loyalist \(American Revolution\)") (167).
  * A Corps of [Hessian](/wiki/Hessian_\(soldier\) "Hessian \(soldier\)") [Jaegers](/wiki/J%C3%A4ger_\(infantry\) "Jäger \(infantry\)") (224).
  * [Royal Regiment of Artillery](/wiki/Royal_Artillery "Royal Artillery") \- No. 1 and 6 Companies of the 3rd Battalion, No 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 8 Companies of the 4th Battalion (200), and Hesse-Kassel artillery.
  * A detachment of [Royal Navy](/wiki/Royal_Navy "Royal Navy") artillery with 47 guns.
  * A detachment of Slaves employed in the Artillery batteries (154).
  * A [Corps of guides and Pioneers](/wiki/Black_Company_of_Pioneers "Black Company of Pioneers") (72).
  * A Brigade of Engineers and [Black Pioneers](/wiki/Black_Company_of_Pioneers "Black Company of Pioneers")
  * A Brigade of British reinforcements from [Georgia](/wiki/Georgia_\(U.S._state\) "Georgia \(U.S. state\)"), composed of; 
    * 1st and 2nd Battalions of the [71st Highlanders](/wiki/71st_Regiment_of_Foot,_Fraser%27s_Highlanders "71st Regiment of Foot, Fraser's Highlanders") (869).
    * Light companies of the [16th](/wiki/Bedfordshire_and_Hertfordshire_Regiment "Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire Regiment") and the [71st](/wiki/71st_Regiment_of_Foot,_Fraser%27s_Highlanders "71st Regiment of Foot, Fraser's Highlanders") (243).
    * Light company of the 3rd Battalion, [New Jersey Volunteers](/wiki/New_Jersey_Volunteers_\(Skinner%27s_Greens\) "New Jersey Volunteers \(Skinner's Greens\)").
    * [17th Regiment of Light Dragoons](/wiki/17th_Lancers "17th Lancers") (73).
    * A Brigade of Engineers and Black Pioneers (206).
    * The [British Legion Cavalry](/wiki/British_Legion_\(American_Revolution\) "British Legion \(American Revolution\)") (211).
    * The [British Legion Infantry](/wiki/British_Legion_\(American_Revolution\) "British Legion \(American Revolution\)") (287).
    * [Patrick Ferguson's](/wiki/Patrick_Ferguson "Patrick Ferguson") Battalion of American volunteers (335).
    * Two battalions of The South Carolina Royalists[South Carolina](/wiki/South_Carolina "South Carolina") [Loyalist](/wiki/Loyalist_\(American_Revolution\) "Loyalist \(American Revolution\)") (372).
    * Royal North Carolina Regiment of [Loyalists](/wiki/Loyalist_\(American_Revolution\) "Loyalist \(American Revolution\)").
    * A company of Georgia loyalist militia (32).
    * A squadron of Georgia loyalist dragoons (40).
    * New York volunteers.
  * A Brigade of British reinforcements from [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City"), composed of; 
    * Two Battalions of the [42nd Regiment of Foot](/wiki/42nd_Regiment_of_Foot "42nd Regiment of Foot").
    * A [Hessian](/wiki/Hessian_\(soldier\) "Hessian \(soldier\)") regiment of Fusiliers.
    * The Prince of Wales American Regiment (334).
    * [Queen's Rangers](/wiki/Queen%27s_Rangers "Queen's Rangers") Regiment of [Loyalists](/wiki/Loyalist_\(American_Revolution\) "Loyalist \(American Revolution\)") (200).
    * The [Volunteers of Ireland](/wiki/Volunteers_of_Ireland "Volunteers of Ireland") Regiment of Loyalists (~423).

The British naval forces that accompanied the invasion were commanded by [Vice
Admiral](/wiki/Vice_Admiral "Vice Admiral") [Mariot
Arbuthnot](/wiki/Mariot_Arbuthnot "Mariot Arbuthnot"), and were composed thus:

  * 4,500 personnel
  * Ships 
    * [HMS  _Europa_](/wiki/HMS_Europa_\(1765\) "HMS Europa \(1765\)") (500 men, 64 guns)
    * [HMS  _Raisonnable_](/wiki/HMS_Raisonnable_\(1768\) "HMS Raisonnable \(1768\)") (500 men, 64 guns)
    * [HMS  _Renown_](/wiki/HMS_Renown_\(1774\) "HMS Renown \(1774\)") (350 men, 50 guns)
    * [HMS  _Romulus_](/w/index.php?title=HMS_Romulus_\(1777\)&action=edit&redlink=1 "HMS Romulus \(1777\) \(page does not exist\)") (280 men, 44 guns)
    * [HMS  _Rainbow_](/w/index.php?title=HMS_Rainbow_\(1747\)&action=edit&redlink=1 "HMS Rainbow \(1747\) \(page does not exist\)") (350 men, 44 guns)
    * **[HMS _Roebuck_](/wiki/HMS_Roebuck_\(1774\) "HMS Roebuck \(1774\)")** (280 men, 44 guns - Flagship)
    * [HMS  _Blonde_](/wiki/HMS_Blonde_\(1760\) "HMS Blonde \(1760\)") (220 men, 32 guns)
    * [HMS  _Perseus_](/w/index.php?title=HMS_Perseus_\(1776\)&action=edit&redlink=1 "HMS Perseus \(1776\) \(page does not exist\)") (20 guns)
    * [HMS  _Camilla_](/wiki/HMS_Camilla_\(1776\) "HMS Camilla \(1776\)") (160 men, 20 guns)
    * [HMS _Raleigh_](/wiki/USS_Raleigh_\(1776\) "USS Raleigh \(1776\)") (220 men, 32 guns)
    * [HMS _Virginia_](/wiki/USS_Virginia_\(1776\) "USS Virginia \(1776\)") (200 men, 28 guns)
    * [HMS  _Richmond_](/wiki/HMS_Richmond_\(1757\) "HMS Richmond \(1757\)") (220 men, 32 guns)
    * [HMS  _Vigilant_](/wiki/HMS_Vigilant_\(1777\) "HMS Vigilant \(1777\)") (160 men, 22 guns - later burnt as unfit)
    * HM armed ship _Germaine_ (125 men, 20 guns)
    * Armed galleys 
      * [HM galley _Comet_](/wiki/HM_galley_Comet_\(1777\) "HM galley Comet \(1777\)") (40 men, 7 guns)
      * HM galley _Scourge_
      * HM galley _Vindictive_
      * [HM galley _Viper_](/wiki/HMS_Viper_\(1779\) "HMS Viper \(1779\)")
  * 90 transport ships accompanied the fleet, including: 
    * HMS _Polly_
    * _Aeolus_
    * _Apollo_
    * _Diana_
    * _Russia Merchant_
    * _Silver Eel_

  
  
### Franco-American
forces[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_Charleston&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Franco-American forces")]

The Franco-American garrison of Charleston was overall led by [Benjamin
Lincoln](/wiki/Benjamin_Lincoln "Benjamin Lincoln"). The [Continental
Army](/wiki/Continental_Army "Continental Army") troops were nominally led by
Brigadier General [William Moultrie](/wiki/William_Moultrie "William
Moultrie")

The ground and naval forces were composed thus:

[hide]Franco-American Order of Battle[2]  
---  
  
  * A brigade of [South Carolina](/wiki/South_Carolina "South Carolina") [Continentals](/wiki/Continental_Army "Continental Army"): 
    * [1st South Carolina Regiment](/wiki/1st_South_Carolina_Regiment "1st South Carolina Regiment") (231).
    * [2nd South Carolina Regiment](/wiki/2nd_South_Carolina_Regiment "2nd South Carolina Regiment") (266).
    * [3rd South Carolina Regiment](/wiki/3rd_South_Carolina_Regiment "3rd South Carolina Regiment") (302).
    * [Pulaski's Legion of Infantry](/wiki/Pulaski%27s_Legion "Pulaski's Legion").
  * A brigade of [North Carolina](/wiki/North_Carolina "North Carolina") [Continentals](/wiki/Continental_Army "Continental Army"): 
    * [1st North Carolina Regiment](/wiki/1st_North_Carolina_Regiment "1st North Carolina Regiment") (260).
    * [2nd North Carolina Regiment](/wiki/2nd_North_Carolina_Regiment "2nd North Carolina Regiment") (244).
    * [3rd North Carolina Regiment](/wiki/3rd_North_Carolina_Regiment "3rd North Carolina Regiment") (~94).
    * A Corps of [South Carolina](/wiki/South_Carolina "South Carolina") light infantry (175).
  * 2nd [Virginia](/wiki/Virginia "Virginia") brigade: 
    * 1st Virginia Detachment (258).
    * 2nd Virginia Detachment (323).
    * A squadron of the [1st](/wiki/1st_Continental_Light_Dragoons "1st Continental Light Dragoons") and [3rd Continental Light Dragoons](/wiki/3rd_Continental_Light_Dragoons "3rd Continental Light Dragoons") (31).
    * A squad of [Armand's Legion](/wiki/Armand%27s_Legion "Armand's Legion") (4).
    * A squadron of the [Georgia Regiment of Horse Rangers](/wiki/Georgia_Regiment_of_Horse_Rangers "Georgia Regiment of Horse Rangers") (41).
    * A group of Georgia continental officers (6).
    * A battalion of [North Carolina](/wiki/North_Carolina "North Carolina") Light Infantry (202).
    * A detachment of [North Carolina Light Dragoons](/wiki/Corps_of_North_Carolina_Light_Dragoons "Corps of North Carolina Light Dragoons")
  * A brigade of Continental Artillery consisting of 391 guns
  * A brigade of Engineers (7 men, 600 slaves)
  * 1st brigade of South Carolina [militia](/wiki/Militia_\(United_States\) "Militia \(United States\)"): 
    * Beaufort District Regiment of Militia
    * 1st Battalion of the Charles Town District Regiment of Militia (302).
    * 2nd Battalion of the Charles Town District Regiment of Militia (485).
    * Granville County Regiment of Militia
    * Colleton County Regiment of Militia
    * Berkeley County Regiment of Militia
  * 2nd brigade of South Carolina [militia](/wiki/Militia_\(United_States\) "Militia \(United States\)"): 
    * Camden District Regiment of Militia
    * Fairfield Regiment of Militia
    * 1st Spartan Regiment of Militia
    * 2nd Spartan Regiment of Militia
    * New Acquisition District Regiment of Militia
  * 3rd brigade of South Carolina [militia](/wiki/Militia_\(United_States\) "Militia \(United States\)"): 
    * Upper Ninety-Six District Regiment of Militia
    * Lower Ninety-Six District Regiment of Militia
    * Lower District Regiment of Militia
    * Little River District Regiment of Militia
    * Orangeburgh District Regiment of Militia
  * 4th brigade of South Carolina [militia](/wiki/Militia_\(United_States\) "Militia \(United States\)"): 
    * Cheraws District Regiment of Militia
    * Georgetown District Regiment of Militia
    * Lower Craven County Regiment of Militia
    * Upper Craven County Regiment of Militia
    * Kingstree Regiment of Militia
  * A brigade of [North Carolina](/wiki/North_Carolina "North Carolina") [militia](/wiki/Militia_\(United_States\) "Militia \(United States\)"): 
    * 1st North Carolina Regiment of Militia
    * 2nd North Carolina Regiment of Militia
    * 3rd North Carolina Regiment of Militia
    * 4th North Carolina Regiment of Militia
  * A brigade of [Virginia](/wiki/Virginia "Virginia") [militia](/wiki/Militia_\(United_States\) "Militia \(United States\)"): 
    * Amelia County Militia
    * A company of the [Chasseurs-Volontaires de Saint-Domingue](/wiki/Chasseurs-Volontaires_de_Saint-Domingue "Chasseurs-Volontaires de Saint-Domingue") (43).[9]
    * A Spanish company of militia (42).
  * 1st Virginia Brigade of [Continentals](/wiki/Continental_Army "Continental Army"), arrived as reinforcements on April 8: 
    * [1st Virginia Regiment](/wiki/1st_Virginia_Regiment "1st Virginia Regiment") (336).
    * [2nd Virginia Regiment](/wiki/2nd_Virginia_Regiment "2nd Virginia Regiment") (306).
    * [3rd Virginia Regiment](/wiki/3rd_Virginia_Regiment "3rd Virginia Regiment") (252).

The Franco-American naval forces that accompanied the defence of the city were
commanded by [Commodore](/wiki/Commodore_\(United_States\) "Commodore \(United
States\)") [Abraham Whipple](/wiki/Abraham_Whipple "Abraham Whipple"), and
were composed thus:

  * [Continental Navy](/wiki/Continental_Navy "Continental Navy") ships: 
    * [USS Ranger](/wiki/USS_Ranger_\(1777\) "USS Ranger \(1777\)") (35 Marines, 20 guns)
    * [USS Queen of France](/wiki/USS_Queen_of_France_\(1777\) "USS Queen of France \(1777\)") (50 marines, 28 guns)
    * [USS Providence](/wiki/USS_Providence_\(1776_frigate\) "USS Providence \(1776 frigate\)") (16 marines, 32 guns)
    * [USS Boston](/wiki/USS_Boston_\(1777\) "USS Boston \(1777\)") (50 marines, 30 guns)
  * [South Carolina state ships](/wiki/South_Carolina_Navy "South Carolina Navy"): 
    * Bricole (44 guns)
    * General Moultrie (20 guns)
    * Notre Dame (16 guns)
    * Marquis de Britigney (7 guns)
    * Lee (4 guns)
    * Revenge (7 guns)
  * [French Navy](/wiki/French_Navy "French Navy") ships: 
    * L'Aventure (26 guns)
    * Truite (26 guns)
    * Zephyr (18 guns)
